loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is a school teacher and lives with his wife, who is also a teacher. The family has been engaged in beekeeping for five years. Stepan has applied for this loan to develop his beekeeping. He plans to purchase 15 more beehives, which will allow him to receive more honey. Honey is in great demand not only in the city, but also in the region, so meeting this demand will allow Stepan to increase his income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is a beekeeper who has five beehives. His current income from beekeeping is barely enough to pay for his family's living expenses.

Artak lives with his father, wife and son.  He would like to expand his farm and earn more income. With the help of this loan Artak plans to purchase 15 more beehives. He hopes that expanding his beekeeping operations will allow him to make his farm more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy beehives

loans.name: Nayelya

texts.en:
Nayelya lives with her husband and two sons. Nayelya and her husband are both teachers at the local school, as well as running a farm, where they keep cows and sheep. 

Nayelya would like to expand her farm, thus she has applied for a loan. With the loan's help she plans to purchase cattle. Nayelya plans to develop her farm, increasing the income. This will allow her to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Filomaine

texts.fr:
Filomaine est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un blanchisseur. Elle a trois enfants.
Filomaine travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle  vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Filomaine a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Filomaine voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille
texts.en:
Filomaine, age 37, is married to a laundry worker and has three children. She's been working as a reseller since 1999.

She sells general food products to any customer at her home and works alone. She purchases her supplies in Lomé.

At this time, her main difficulty is that she is out of stock. She's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy general food products.

She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, Filomaine would like to expand her business. She says that she intends to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan investment, she will buy a sewing machine and larger quantities of some embroidery materials such as beads and thread. This will allow her to improve her business conditions and increase her sales and profits.

Sewing and embroidery is a very common profession among ladies and there is a lot of competition. Yasmeen has been operating her business for many years, and she is confident about her success as a result of loan investment.

Her husband is an electrician by profession while her eldest son has a business selling medicine.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery materials.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 29-year-old young woman and is married with four daughters. Her husband works in furniture making with a low income which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Rasha wants to improve the family's income and share the expenses of life with her husband by having her own project, which is a beauty salon. She is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new beauty salon equipment such as hair dryers, a collection of hair brushes, hair and body creams, etc. This will improve her work and increase the family's income.

Rasha is a conservative woman, so her husband Ramzi is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Vitalik

texts.en: Vitalik is a 30-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and three children. Vitalik has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle he has and to develop cattle breeding. This will allow him to get more income and invest it in the farm's further expansion in the future. Besides, Vitalik will be able to make savings to invest in his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad is 31 years old and married. She supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful and has great creative sense in her work. Due to her high-quality work, she receives regular orders every month.

Dilshad is the mother of 2 sons, the eldest one studies in class 2 while her younger son is only 2 years old. Her husband works at a bus station.

Dilshad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become rough and needs replacement. With the new sewing machine, she will be able to complete her orders on time and earn more profits. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a new sewing machine will help her to make her business better.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 21 years old. He lives with his mother and brother. Samson is involved in cattle breeding.

Samson would like to expand his farm and develop his cattle breeding. To get sufficient financial means, he has applied for a loan. With the requested loan, Samson plans to purchase cows. Expansion of the farm will allow Samson to get more income and insure improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr:
Mawussé est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un gestionnaire. Elle a un enfant. 
Mawussé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des tissus bazin pour tous clients à de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire la demande de tous clients.
MAwussé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus bazin. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mawussé voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawussé is 29 years old. She is married to an administrator and has one child.

Mawussé has been working as a reseller since 2011. She is a street vendor and sells damask cloth to all types of customers. She gets her supplies in Lomé and works alone. Her principal challenge at this time is that she is not able to satisfy all her customers´ demands.

Mawussé is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on damask cloth. She would like to reinvest in her business. 

In the coming years, Mawussé would like to expand her business activity. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en:
Sevada is a 24-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and child.

Sevada would like to expand his farm, so he has applied for a loan. Sevada plans to purchase a cow and forage (feed). Expansion of the farm will allow Sevada to sell more milk and increase his income, which is vital for him to insure a brighter future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her blanket-selling business. She supplies blankets to different shops and also to her community clients. With the loan investment, she will buy larger quantities of blankets, allowing her to meet the demand from her clients and increase her income.

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for many years. She is very confident that her business will grow further after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Riffat.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik is involved in agriculture. She keep cattle and cultivates land. Satik has applied for a loan to expand her farm. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase three cows and forage (feed).

An expansion of the farm will allow Satik to increase her income from agriculture and improve her family's living conditions. Satik lives with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a conservative woman, so her husband Faiyeq is photographed instead in the FATEN branch. Jameela is a 60-year-old woman and is the mother of six sons and five daughters. Her husband gets a pension, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs and expenses.

Jameela wants to purchase new home furniture so as to live in better home conditions, things such as living room furniture, dinning room furniture, etc., but since the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing home furniture and improving the house's condition. This will offer better living conditions to the family.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Shehadeh

texts.en: Shehadeh is a 26-year-old young man. He is engaged and will get married soon. He is a worker with a decent salary, but it is not enough to cover his needs and wedding expenses. Shehadeh is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses needed to prepare well for his wedding, such as purchasing necessary home furniture and appliances. This will help Shehadeh to feel comfortable and enjoy his wedding. Shehadeh is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Amor por su familia es la mejor palabra con la que se puede identificar a Luz Dary, quien toda su vida ha trabajado con el fin de mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Luz Dary siempre ha tenido el sueño de poderles brindar a sus 2 hijos una educación universitaria que les permita conseguir un empleo bien remunerado, sin embargo, se ha presentado con diferentes adversidades en su vida en las que ve como deben recurrir a que sus sueños se vean aplazados. Luz Dary con el ánimo de poder generar unos ingresos superiores, ha montado un puesto de comidas rápidas, donde sus clientes la tienen bien referenciada por ser de muy buena calidad. Como con el negocio de las comidas rápidas le ha ido tan bien, Luz Dary aspira a que su puesto de comidas rápidas ofrezca mayor variedad de productos a los que ofrece actualmente, por lo que quiere comprar una freidora doble que le permita preparar más comidas rápidas al mismo tiempo. Sin embargo, Luz Dary no cuenta con el capital suficiente para esto, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una freidora doble y a comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar las comidas los primeros días.
Luz Dary espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente y pueda cumplir su sueño de brindarles a sus hijos una educación universitaria y pueda mejorarles la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Love for her family is the best way to identify Luz Dary, who has worked her whole life with the goal of improving the quality of life of her husband and her two children.  Luz Dary always has had the dream of being able to give her two children a university education that will allow them to get a well-paying job.  Nevertheless, she has confronted various adversities in her life in which she had to resort to seeing her dreams postponed.

Luz Dary, with the goal of being able to generate higher income, has set up a fast-food stand that her customers mention as being of very good quality.  Since the fast-food business has gone so well for her, Luz Dary wants her fast-food stand to offer a greater variety of products than what she currently offers, so she wants to buy a double deep fryer that will allow her to make more fast food at the same time.

However, Luz Dary does not have the necessary capital for this.  She hopes a loan will give her the opportunity to succeed in buying a double deep fryer and the necessary supplies to make her food the first days.

Luz Dary hopes that in this way her income will go up considerably and she can realize her dream of giving her children a university education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a double deep fryer that allows her to prepare more food to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s business, where he sells betel leaves, cigarettes, and cold drinks. The stall from which he operates his business is located in the market. He deals with his customers in a very professional manner and earns a reasonably good income from his business. With the loan investment, he will buy cold drinks, different brands of cigarettes, and betel leaves in larger quantities to improve his business.

Nasreen is the mother of four other children. Two of them work while the remaining two are getting their education. Her husband is a mason who provides masonry services to his customers. When he doesn’t get work, he operates the cold drink business with her son.

Nasreen is very active and performs her household duties very well. Her son started his business 3 years ago, and Nasreen is hopeful that a loan investment will help him to become established in his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks, betel leaves, and cigarettes for her son's business.

loans.name: Ablamvi

texts.fr:
Ablanvi est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est célibataire. 
Ablanvi travaille comme coiffeur depuis 2007. Il coiffe tous les clients dans son atelier. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Ablanvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des outils de travail et aménager son atelier. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablanvi voudrait ouvrir un autre atelier.
texts.en:
Ablanvi, age 27, is single. He's been a hairdresser since 2007. He does all his customer's hairstyling in his salon, where he works alone.

At this time, his main difficulty is being unable to meet customer demand. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to purchase hairdressing tools and fix up his hair salon.

He wants to reinvest in his business. In the forthcoming years, he would like to open another salon.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and fix up his hair salon

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hog raiser in her village. She raises hogs to resell for a profit. She has been patiently doing this for almost five years. She usually earns PHP 2,000 for each hog she sells. The profits gained from her business are used for meals and to pay bills at home. All of her children have already settled into marriage. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for the hogs. Hopefully, she will save enough funds to have on hand for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the hogs.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is 44 years old, married with 3 children aged 16, 22 and 24. She runs a butcher shop to earn a living, has been in the business for four years and has employed three people. Mariana earns extra income from her rental houses. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz Elena ha trabajado toda su vida en el sector de la confección, y gracias a la experiencia que adquirió sus productos son muy apetecidos por su buena calidad.
Desde muy joven Beatriz Elena comenzó a trabajar con su familia en un taller de confección, y hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió montar su propio taller de confección y dedicarse al servicio de confección a terceros. Desde entonces esta es su fuente de ingresos y con esto ayuda al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. 
Beatriz Elena es muy reconocida en su sector por ser una persona muy amable y trabajadora, y todo esto le ha ayudado a que sus clientes sean fieles a sus productos. Beatriz Elena tiene el gran sueño de que su taller crezca y se pueda expandir, para poder generar empleo y colaborarle a las demás personas mejorándoles su calidad de vida.
Beatriz Elena actualmente tiene un pedido de un cliente suyo que requiere de la compra de más tela, hilos y algunas herramientas de trabajo, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros productos para confeccionar el pedido que le hizo un cliente y seguir obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para su hogar.
Beatriz Elena quiere que en un futuro su negocio le brinde mayores ingresos, y pueda brindarles a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una carrera universitaria que le permita tener un empleo bien remunerado en un futuro.
texts.en:
Beatriz Elena has worked for her whole life in the area of tailoring.  Thanks to the experience that she acquired, her products are very well-liked for their good quality.
When she was very young, Beatriz Elena began to work with her family in a tailoring workshop, and about 7 years ago she decided to start her own tailoring workshop and focus on third party tailoring services.  Since then, this has been her main source of income and with this she helps to provide support for the household costs, where she lives with her husband and 3 children.
Beatriz Elena is very well known in her area for being a kind and hard-working person.  All of this has helped her to have customers who are loyal to her products.  Beatriz Elena has a big dream that her workshop will grow and expand so that she will be able to create jobs and collaborate with more people to improve their quality of life.
Beatriz Elena currently has an order from a customer of hers that requires that she buy more fabric, thread, and some tools of the trade.  However, she does not have enough money to make these purchases.  This is why she is hoping that a loan will offer her the opportunity to make the purchase of fabric, thread, needles, and other products to make the order that her customer requested and continue obtaining the necessary income for her home.
Beatriz Elena wants her business to bring in a better income.  She wants to offer her children the opportunity to obtain a bachelor's degree that will allow them to have a well-paying job in the future.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and needles to make a client's order.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a 35-year-old retailer from Armavir. He trades clothing in the city market. Artur has applied for a loan to increase his inventory. With the loan's help, he plans to purchase more clothing to sell. Artur will increase his sales, which will allow him to get more income. With additional income, Artur will ensure more prosperous living conditions for his family. Artur lives with his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell.

loans.name: Midji Koffi

texts.fr:
Midji Koffi est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å un/e couturière. Il a 01enfant.
Midji Koffi travaille comme revendeur de cassettes depuis 2010. Il exerce seul son activité dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé et achéte ses marchandises à Lomé. 
Midji Koffi a requis son cycle de prêt crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cassettes.
Dans les prochaines années, Midji Koffi voudrait avoir une boutique pour répondre plus à la demande de la clientèle. Et pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Midji Koffi is a 37-year-old man. He is married to a seamstress. He has one child.

Midji Koffi has been selling cassette tapes since 2010. He runs his business by himself in a neighborhood of Lomé, and he buys his products in Lomé.

Midji Koffi is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to buy cassette tapes.

In the coming years, Midji Koffi would like to have a shop in order to better meet the demand of his customers, and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy cassette tapes

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 31 years old and married with two children aged 2 and 4. He sells water to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed two people. He also runs a retail shop to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income, and he hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy  a water tank.

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr:
Kangni est un homme âgé de 59 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a trois enfants.  
Kangni travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il vend des cartes de recharge pour tous clients en ambulant. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire toute la  demande.
Kangni a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kangni voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kangni is a 59-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has three children.

Kangni has been working as a retailer since 2006. He sells calling cards door-to-door to a wide array of customers. He buys his products in Lomé. He works by himself. Currently, the biggest challenge for him is not being able to meet all of the demand.

Kangni is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy calling cards. He wants to reinvest in his business.

In the coming years, Kangni would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy calling cards

loans.name: Naila's Group

texts.en:
Naila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy cooking oil, spices, etc. to fill the clients' orders and increase his profits. He is very professional in his business dealings and has started his business just recently. Naila is confident that his business will be more established after the loan investment.

Naila is the mother of a 10 year old daughter who is studying in class 2. In order to afford her education, Naila sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful in her work and has the ability to make beautiful looking clothes according to the latest fashion.

She is confident about the better financial future of her family after the loan investment into her husband’s business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices and other grocery items for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran is 56 years old. She is still very active and performs her household duties very well.  She also sews clothes for her neighboring clients to fulfill the basic needs of her family.  She is the mother of four sons. Two of them are laborers, while her youngest son stays at home. Gulzaran couldn’t provide education to her children due to financial constraints.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who has a business selling animals. He buys buffaloes, raises them and then sells them for profit. He also sells buffalo milk for extra profit.  With the loan investment, he will buy a young buffalo for the further expansion of his business.  He is an experienced person in his business, and Gulzaran is confident that the loan investment will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for an animal sales business.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 30 years old and married. He and his wife have one child, a 1-year-old. 

Celestin sells spare parts. His business is well-organized. He works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day. He has three years of experience in this business. 

Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more spare parts to sell. With the profits from the loan, Celestin will reinvest in his business and pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cups, plates, and spoons.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old, a single mother of one child living in Hioma, Uganda. After resigning from a tobacco company that she used to work for, she decided to use her gratuity to start a retail shop. She faces the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand and her dream is a wholesale shop.

Jane's personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house for her young family. She intends to use the loan to buy books and other scholastic materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy books and other scholastic materials to sell

loans.name: Yerem

texts.en:
Yerem is involved in cattle breeding. He lives with his mother and sister who works at the local university. For many years, Yerem has sustained the family and now has sufficient means to develop his farm. 

Yerem has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and forage (plant leaves and stems eaten by livestock). By developing his cattle-breeding business, Yerem will earn more income and be able to invest it in his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and forage (food for livestock).

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Rahila's Group

texts.en:
Rahila is 32 years old and married. She is the mother of one son and one daughter. Rahila's son is studying while her daughter is not of schoolgoing age yet.

Rahila's husband is a rickshaw driver. She supports her husband by operating a clothes-sewing and embroidery business.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy clothes and embroidery materials for making better-quality embroidered clothes.

Rahila is very hardworking. She is confident that her business will grow more successful and that she will be able to improve her income as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes and embroidery materials for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Philbert

texts.en: Philbert is 35 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 11 years old. Philbert has five years of experience selling cows. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 7 pm every day. Philbert has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cows to sell. With any profits from the loan, Philbert would like to build a house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is involved in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates land. 

Robert would like to develop his cattle-breeding business, which will require some financial investments. With the help of this loan, Robert will increase the number of cattle as well as purchase forage (plants and stems eaten by livestock). 

This loan will help Robert earn more income from agriculture, which will help him to provide better living conditions for his family. Robert lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy cattle and forage (food for livestock).

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 35 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of nine and 17 years. Her business is well-organized. She sells chickens and works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Alphonsine employs two people to help her. She has three years of experience in her businesss. 

Alphonsine has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of chickens to sell. With this profit resulting from the loan, Alphonsine will be able to buy more food for her family and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of chickens.

loans.name: Ghulam Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Sakina has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. By using the loan money, she will buy a new sewing machine. This will allow her to finish the client orders on time and increase her profits, as her current sewing machine has become old and she is unable to work properly. 

Her husband is a driver and provides transportation services to his passengers.

Ghulam is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a laborer, while her other children stay at home.

Ghulam is very efficient and is teaching the art of sewing to her daughter. She is hopeful that her daughter will use her skills to earn income after marriage.

She is also confident about her business success as a result of a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a young farmer from Gndevaz Village. He is involved in cattle breeding. Artur needs some financial means to expand his farm. He plans to purchase a cow, a bull, and ten sheep. To implement this goal, Artur has applied for a loan. 

Expansion of the farm will allow Artur to increase his income and sustain his family with improved living conditions. Artur lives with his wife and children.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a bull, and sheep.

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha, 38 years old, is divorced and has no children. She is a school director with a decent salary which is not enough to cover all her costs and expenses. Suha wants to purchase new home furniture such as living room furniture, bedroom furniture, etc. to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a US $3,000 loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture. Suha is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Bothina

texts.en: Bothina is a 35-year-old single young woman. She lives with her parents and her brother, a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Bothina raises poultry but she lacks fodder. She wants to purchase fodder in bulk to feed her poultry. She also needs to purchase a new space heater for warmth in the winter season. Bothina is requesting a $3,000 US loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more fodder to feed the poultry and a new space heater to improve the family's living conditions. Bothina is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and a new space heater

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 49 years old and married, with three children between 10 and 23 years old. He owns a business selling local drinks. This is his second year in this business.  He works from 7 AM until 6 PM every day. 

Innocent has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantity of local drinks to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase more quantity of local drinks.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi, 31 years old, is married with no children yet. He has operated an aluminum workshop for eight years, and it is a profitable project but not enough to cover the family's needs and work expenses. It is the family's only source of income. Shadi wants to purchase a new car for his personal use and to help him  in carrying and traveling for work. He is requesting a $2,500 US loan from FATEN to help him complete the price of purchasing new car. This will improve both his family and work conditions. Shadi is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a 39-year-old. She is married and has three children who are 8 and 13 years old. She owns a business of soft drinks. This is her sixth year in this business. She works from 8AM until 6PM every day. She currently employs two people to help her. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of beer like Primus, Amuster, Mitsing, and Guiness to sell. 

With any profits, she will be able to reinvest in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more beer like Primus, Amuster, Mitsing, and Guiness to sell.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, 37 years old, is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker who earns a decent salary which is not enough, however, to cover the family's needs. For the past 15 years, Lubna and her husband have also owned a small farm, which has been a profitable project.

Lubna is requesting a US $1,000 loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing seedlings and fertilizers to have better crops. This will improve the agricultural season, increase sales and improve the family's income. Lubna is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in her place.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 51 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 21 years old. Elias' business is well-organized. He sells local drinks and works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Elias employs two people to help him. He has three years of experience in this business.

Elias has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more quantities of local drinks to sell. With his profit from the loan, Elias will be able to buy more food for his family, to reinvest in his business and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more quantities of local drinks.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is 37 years old and married. She has two children, ages 4 and 6. Joselyne has four years of experience selling items in her general store.

Joselyne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying more cooking oil, rice, sugar, pans and books to sell. With the profits from the loan, Joselyne would like to satisfy her family's basic needs and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sugar, pans and books to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 22 years old and single. He operates a general store which is open from 6 a.m. until 2 p.m. every day. He currently employs two people to help him. Aloys has one year of experience in this business.

Aloys has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more quantities of tableware, soap, rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for medical insurance and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory items.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, 44 years old, is married and has five children. She has been selling bananas for 5 years to earn a living and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. Eunice hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more materials such as machines and chairs for his salon

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her sewing business. The loan will allow her to buy a new sewing machine which will enable her to complete the orders on time and improve her services and profits. Nasreen has been operating her business for many years and is confident that her business will become more profitable as a result of this loan investment.

Nasreen's husband sells wheat and other agricultural products, earning a reasonable income every month. Nasreen has one son who is studying in the 4th grade. Nasreen is illiterate but she strongly knows the importance of education. She wants her son to become successful in life by completing his schooling. Note: In the photo, Nasreen is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and is married with four children between the ages 5 and 9. She sells vegetables and fruits, and her business is well-organized. She works from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Fatuma has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more vegetables and fruits to sell. With the profit from the loans, Fatuma will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Luvender

texts.en: Luvender is 26 years old and runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 months and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy hair relaxers and a hair blow dry machine.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxers and a hair blow dry machine

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a single woman. She has a daughter. She describes herself to be a confident woman. She operates a retail business where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for six months. Her business is located within town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be varying prices of food. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for food. Fridah's business goal is to venture into farming business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Glorious

texts.en: Glorious is 28 years old and is married with three children. She sells fruits such as oranges to earn a living. She been in this business for 5 years and describes her business environment as good because she has regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more oranges to sell.

loans.use: To buy more oranges to sell

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old. He sells African clothes and works from 7am until 7pm every day. Faustin employs one person to help him. He has three years of experience in this businesss. 

Faustin has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more African clothes to sell. With the profit from the loan, Faustin will be able to buy more food for his family and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao (in the photo), age 30, is a garment worker. Her husband Sophea, age 30, is a rice farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free from farming. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have one young son.

Mao is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s farming business. She needs to buy a water pumping machine and pipe because the old one breaks and does not work.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine and pipe.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in Kapan with her husband, daughter and parents-in-law. Susanna has been engaged in cattle breeding for twelve years. She has applied for a loan to increase the number of her cattle and to purchase forage for them. With an increased number of cattle, Susanna will collect more milk, which she uses to make and sell cheese. Susanna will also increase her sales and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and is married. He owns a business of transporting people. This is his third successful years in this business and he is open from 6 am until 9 pm every day. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase tires for his business. Emmanuel hopes to earn more profits. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his business.

loans.name: Art

texts.en:
Art (in the photo) and her husband, Roeung, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for almost 30 years and have nine children: seven daughters and two sons.

Art is a weaver, while her husband stays at home. She is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials. She will also use part of the loan to renovate her restroom because it is old and small.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business and renovate her restroom.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram, 40 years old, lives with his wife and son. He works at the local village hall and is also involved in cattle breeding, which is the main source of income for the family. Unable to find sufficient financial means to develop the farm, Aram has applied for a loan. He plans to use it to purchase 2 cows and to renovate the barn. This loan will help Aram to make his farm more stable and to further develop it.

loans.use: to pay for cows and barn renovations

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: C13516 Dukoranimbaraga Group

texts.en:
Fabier is forty years old and is married with four children between the ages of six and twelve. Fabier sells shoes and his works goes from 7am until 7pm every day. He is the first person on the right side of the photo with the raised hand. Fabier is the president of this group called "C13516 Dukoranimbaraga" in the local language.

Fabier has requested a loan from Kiva lender, Vision Finance Company, in order to increase his business by buying more shoes to sell. With the profits from the loan, Fabier will buy food for his family and save money.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 48 years old. A hard-working woman, she works as a pharmacist's assistant.

Maryam has a son named Mohammad who likes all types of sports so he registered to study physical education. He is now in his fourth year, so Maryam has applied for a loan to pay her son’s semester fees so he can graduate and start working in his field.

Because Maryam is a conservative person, she asked her son Mohammad to represent her in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Sor Phoirn

texts.en: Sor Phoirn is a babysitter for an orphanage. She also weaves scarves at home in her free time. Her husband, Ratha, is a radio and television repairman. Sor Phoirn is asking for another loan of $800 to buy weaving material for her business and materials needed in her husband’s business. The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy weaving material for her business and materials needed in her husband’s radio and television repair business

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn (pictured above) and her husband, Vorn, are farmers. When free from farming, she also weaves at home. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have 8 children- 6 sons and 2 daughters. 

Soeurn is applying for another loan of 600 USD in order to continue her businesses. She will buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Chanhorn

texts.en:
Chanhorn and her husband Lean (pictured together) are weavers. Chanhorn’s husband is also hired by villagers to farm. He wants to launch his own farming business but he does not have capital. Therefore, Chanhorn is requesting another loan of $500 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. 

Chanhorn and her husband have been married since 2003 and have two young sons. They live on an island in the Mekong River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
Kanha is 25 years old and her husband, Sophea, is 32 years old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son. Kanha and her husband are farmers; they grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. 

In addition, Kanha’s husband has motorized hand tiller which he rents out to his neighbors to plow farmland or move things or goods, and gets paid with fees. Unfortunately, the motorized hand tiller is old and breaks (pictured behind Kanha). So Kanha decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 500 USD in order to make the repairs. She will also use a part of the loan to buy an electric saw. With electric saw, they can use it to cut trees as firewood.

loans.use: to repair a motorized hand tiller and buy an electric saw

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (pictured here), age 41, is a garment worker. Her husband, Cheang, age 39, is a security guard. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City and have 7 children- 5 sons and 3 daughters. Two of the children are garments workers, four attend school and another one is still young.   

Srey is asking for her first loan in the amount of 600 USD to purchase a motorcycle to get work because often she takes a taxi, which costs lots of money.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to get work

loans.name: Televise

texts.en:
Televise is 31 years of age and is married with seven children.

Televise raises pigs for sale. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Televise needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase animal feeds such as coconuts.  

She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Televise joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Televise's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: purchase animal feeds, such as coconuts.

loans.name: Sav

texts.en:
Sav, age 44, is a garment worker. Her husband, Penh, age 50, is a construction worker and farmer who also raises cows at home. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City and have six children - three sons and three daughters. Two of the children are garment workers and the others attend school.   

Sav is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine. He does not have his own water pumping machine and sometimes needs to borrow one from his relatives or neighbors. He will also use a part of the loan to build a shelter for his cows.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin (in the photo), age 24, is a weaver, while her husband, Pheap, age 27, is a lathe operator. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Narin is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle so that her husband can get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband, Samet, is a construction worker and fisherman. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three young children- two sons and one daughter.

Ry is asking for her second loan in the amount of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Sophon, age 44, is a primary school teacher. Her husband, Cheun, age 42, is a security guard and a cleaner for a hospital. They live in a village across the Mekong River and about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children - one son and one daughter. Sophon is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to get to work.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch and her husband, both 44 years old, live in a village about twenty five Kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have no children yet.  

Toch and her husband are farmers, growing rice and vegetables on their farmland in their village. When free from farming, Toch’s husband also does construction work. Toch is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a new water pumping machine because the old one is broken. In the photo, Toch is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a new water pumping machine.

loans.name: Osana

texts.en:
Osana is forty years old and is married with five children.

Osana owns and operates a business venture, selling fried products to the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.  
  
Osana needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed, such as flour, sugar, and cordials to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Osana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Osana's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw products such as flour, sugar, and cordials to make products for sale.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Aged 43, Sokha is married with five dependent children (one daughter and four sons).  Two of them are paid taxi driver while the other three work at the family’s business.  She is a rural farmer in a village located in the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia. She has been farming rice as the only source of income, for twenty years. 

Sokha’s group consists of four female members and her group has been with Kiva’s field parter, VisionFund, for one year. Since 2010, she has used the loan to make a better living and be able to set aside some money. She currently earns 4 U.S. dollars per day. Sokha and other three members are each applying for another loan of US$300 in KHR equivalent. As the leader, she is going to use this entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy piglets as another source of income. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the farm and piglets for raising

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is 47 years of age, a very active and efficient lady who supports her husband in his livestock business. She gets up early in the morning, milks the buffaloes and sells the milk to her community clients. She is very supportive and operates the business with her husband very well. Surriya has given birth to 4 sons. Her eldest son is a mason while the others stay at home.

Surriya has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk for sale and increase the income. He has been operating his business for many years and Surriya is very confident about his business success.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for livestock business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s scrap selling business. He will use the loan to buy scrap in bulk quantities that will allow him to fill larger orders on time and increase his sales and profits.

Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very hardworking and has raised her 6 children with great effort. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate all of her children. Only two of them are able to get education from a nearby school. Nasreen is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his income by utilizing the loan and that she will be in a position to provide education to her remaining children as a result.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, 46 years old, is married and has 3 sons. Her eldest son is married and works as a clerk. Her remaining 2 children work for the Municipal Corporation. Nasreen's husband also works for the Municipal Corporation while Nasreen supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and makes good-looking clothes. She charges very reasonable rates for her services.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her clothes sewing business. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is old and needs replacement. Nasreen started her business only a couple of years ago and is confident that her business will improve further with the purchase of a new machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Roky

texts.en:
Roky, age 31, lives in a village near the Mekong River about 32 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three young children - one son and two daughters.  

Roky has been running a beauty salon for ten years. She also has a business renting out traditional clothing to villagers for attending weddings and other ceremonies. Roky is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional materials needed in her beauty salon and more traditional clothing to better respond to her customers’ needs. Most Cambodian people prefer to get married in this season; therefore, there are lots of weddings now.

loans.use: To buy additional materials needed in her beauty salon and traditional clothing for her clothing rental business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Oun is a 39-year-old mother of three children. Two of the children are still in school and dependent on her working in the family business. Oun and her husband grow rice and plant cassava as the family’s main source of income. They have been farming rice and planting cassava for 20 and 10 years, respectively. Oun's husband sometimes transports other farmers’ cassava to earn more income. With the current business, Oun earns around US $10 per day. 

Oun is in her first loan cycle with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. She is planning to use her first loan to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her farmland. Oun hopes to use this loan to increase her cassava business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Minika

texts.en:
Minika (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sokhorn is a fisherman. In addition, she also buys some cotton fabric and scarf from other weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. She is asking for a loan of $300 to buy a motorcycle for commuting. 

Minika and her husband have been married since 1993 and have five children-two sons and three daughters. One has full-time employment, another one is a carpenter, two attend school and another one is still young. They are living on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is married and has 8 children, three of whom are studying while the others stay at home and don’t do anything. Her husband operates a food sales business, selling traditional food called dhahi bhaley, which is a very popular local food made of yogurt, spices, and potatoes.

Bilqees has supported her husband by operating a sewing business for many years and now has great skills in her work with the passage of time. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy potatoes, spices and other ingredients so he can prepare dhahi bhaley in larger quantities and of better taste. Bilqees is confident that her husband will be able to earn more profits from his business by offering better quality food to his clients.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and spices to make dhahi bhaley

loans.name: Khean

texts.en:
Khean (pictured with her loom), age 44, is a weaver. Her husband, Saroeun, age 51, is a motor taxi driver. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a carpenter, and another is a tailor who specializes in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. 

Khean is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business. She will also use a part of the loan buy motorbike spare parts for her son-in-law’s motorbike repair business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business and buy motorbike spare parts for her son-in-law’s motorbike repair business.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Torn is a 34-year-old mother of three school going children.  For the family’s main source of income, she and her husband grow rice and plant cassava.  They have been farming rice for twenty years and planting cassava for ten years. Sometimes, they work for other farmers to earn money.  With the current business, Torn earns less than US$10 per day. 

Torn is the first cycled client with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund.  Requesting her first loan, Torn will buy construction materials such as cement, wood, etc. for her house.  With this loan, she hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab, aged 56, is a divorced mother of four children, two of whom are dependents.  She lives in a village located in the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia.  To make a living, she has had a furniture and construction business for ten years.  Sometimes, she works for others earn more money. 

Seab received a loan with VisionFund two years ago and she successfully paid it back.  The loan has helped her make a better living. Now Seab and two other members, who have just joined with VisionFund, are applying for a loan.  As the leader, she will use this loan to buy materials like wood, nails etc.for  her furniture business.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business, and earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy materials like wood, nails... for her furniture business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yoy's Group

texts.en:
A resident in a village located in the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia, Yoy is aged 36 and married with two dependent daughters who are still in school and sometimes work at the family’s business. To make a living, she has been farming rice for twenty three years and she supplements her income by raising pigs. 

Yoy and her group member have been with VisionFund for one year. Since 2010, she has used the loan to make a better living and send her daughters to school regularly. She currently earns around US$5 per day from her business, and is able to save around US$1.5 each day. Now requesting another loan of US$250 in KHR equivalent for each borrower, Yoy will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm.  She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to earn a larger income.  She hopes to set aside some money for the future, and keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than is 58 years old and his wife, Hon, is 56 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have five married children--three sons and two daughters. Three live in separate homes, and the others live in the family home. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Than and his wife are farmers. He is asking for a loan of $800 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice farm

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, aged 36, is a married mother of two dependent daughters, who are still in primary school.  To earn a living, she and her husband has been farming rice as primary business for ten years.   They also work at a cassava plantation sometimes for additional income.

Mach leads a group of four female members.   She has just joined Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund, this loan cycle, while the three other members have been with VisionFund for one year. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and use a large portion to buy a small plot of farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business, to earn a larger income and build some savings.  She hopes to be able to afford a new house and also keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and buy a small plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon, 41, is married and has three dependent children: two daughters and one son, who all go to school.  She is a farmer who grows rice and plants cassava in an area of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia.  She has been in this business for almost twenty years. 

Sinuon and her group member are the second cycled clients with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. She now earns US$4.50 per day to feed her family.  With good business, she is leading her group to apply for another loan of KHR1,200,000 each, to buy fertilizer for her farm. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income, to set aside some money and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, aged 55, lives in a village of the Kang Meas district of Cambodia.  She has two daughters and two sons dependent on her.  Three of her four children work for others for a fee, while the last one is still in school.  Im and her husband are farmers who grow rice twice a year.   They have been farming rice as a primary business for eleven years.  Furthermore, they sometimes work as cooks to make additional income, to better feed their family. 

Im is the second cycle client with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. The first loan since 2010 has enabled her to have some savings and send her child to school regularly. She now earns around US$7 per day from her current business. She plans to use this entire loan to buy a cow.  She will raise the cow for labor to help her with her rice farming.  This loan will enable her to have another cow to increase her rice farming business.  She hopes to earn good profit for her family's future and her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy a cow

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Khuoch's Group

texts.en:
Khuoch, 38, lives in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia and she has two dependent sons still in school. She is a rice farmer who does subsistence farming once per year while her husband is a construction worker. She has been in this business for almost fifteen years. 

This is the second loan for Khuoch’s group with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund.  Her group consists of four female members who have been actively working to support their families.  Khuoch currently earns about US$6 per day from her business and is able to save less than US$2 each day for the future.  As the leader, she will use the entire loan to lease a small plot of land for rice farming.  She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice farm and lead to a larger income, to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To lease a small plot of land for rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
A 37-year-old mother of three children, Oun lives in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia.  Two of her three children work at the family’s business to help earn income while the last one is too young for school.  Rice farming is her main source of income to support the family and she has been farming once a year for almost fifteen years.  She also raise pigs and produces rice wine as an additional source of income to better support the family. 

Oun received a loan from Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund, one year ago and she completely repaid that loan.  Since 2010, the loan has helped her increase her business and have some savings.  She now manages to earn about US$3.50 per day.  She is now requesting another loan from VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy a small plot of land for rice farming.  Oun hopes this loan will help improve her business and allow her to make a better  living.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land for rice farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
A 61-year-old mother of two dependent sons, Huon lives in a village of the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia. Both of her sons work at a garment factory to earn a living. Cassava and rice farming are her main sources of income to support the family and she has been in this business for 30 years. Raising pigs is an additional source of income to better support her family. 

Huon received a loan from Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund, one year ago and she completely repaid the loan. Since 2010, the loan has helped her make a better living and afford a decent house to live in. She now earns about 10 USD per day and is able to save around 5 USD each day. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, Huon will use this loan to buy a water pump for the rice paddies. She hopes this loan will help increase her business so as to earn a larger income, improve her standard of living, and also build on some savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for the rice paddies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
A citizen residing in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Sok is a 58-year-old father of nine children, four of whom (two daughters and two sons) are dependent on him. Three of them work as construction workers for a living, while the last one is still in school. To support his big family, Sok has been farming his three-hectare farmland for 15 years and sometimes he works at wedding ceremonies as an elder. 

Sok has been with VisionFund for five years and completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. Since 2006, the loans have helped him afford sufficient food and improve his living conditions. With his current business, he manages to earn around 10 USD per day. He is leading a group of two members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use this loan to buy fertilizer for farmland for dry season rice. He hopes to make more healthy rice and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland for dry season rice

loans.name: Maly

texts.en:
A resident in a rural area of the Kang Meas district of Cambodia, Maly is now 34 years old and married with two dependent sons who are still in school. She is a farmer who has been growing rice twice per year as the family’s main source of income for 11 years. Selling rice is another source of income to support her living. 

Maly is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. She earns 6 USD per day from her current business. With good business, she is applying for another loan to buy more rice to grind for sale. She hopes to increase her rice business and improve her lifestyle and also keep her sons in school.

loans.use: to buy more rice to grind

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Kol's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia, Kol is 30 years old and married. She has only one daughter, who is still in school. Rice farming has been her main source of income to support her family. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. With her current business, she earns around US $5 per day. 

This is the first loan for Kol’s group with Kiva’s field partner VisionFund. Her group consists of two members. As the leader, she will use the loan to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop. This loan will enable her to harvest the rice crop in a timely way for consumption and sale to support her family and build on some savings to keep her only daughter in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vimean's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village located in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Vimean is now 35 years old and married. Her two dependent children (one son and one daughter) are still in school. Her main source of income is from her two-hectare corn plantation and she has been in this business for more than three years. Sometimes, to earn more income to better feed her family, Vimean works for others for pay.

Vimean received a loan from VisionFund three years ago and completely repaid her loan with VisionFund. The loan has helped support her family timely and regularly. She earns less than US$10 per day from her current business.  

Now leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Vimean as the leader will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her corn plantation. She hopes to plant her corn healthfully and earn a larger income to set aside some money to buy a motorbike for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn plantation

loans.name: Sophar

texts.en:
Sophar and her husband, Voek, are rice farmers. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.  They have three sons and three daughters. 

Sophar is asking for a loan of $300 to assist in her rice farm by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Kuy's Group

texts.en:
Kuy is 26 years old and is a young mother of two dependent daughters who are still too young to attend school.  She is a farmer in a village located in the Moung Russey district. She has been in the farming business with her husband for several years to earn a living. In addition to her main source of income, to better feed the family, her husband also catches fish and eel for sale. 

Kuy received a loan from VisionFund three years ago and had completely repaid back her loan. Since the 2008 loan, she has been able to save some money for the future. Now she and the other two members in the group are requesting a loan with VisionFund.  As the leader, Thuy is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for a water pump to carry water into her rice field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en:
Chhat is a 42-year-old mother of six dependent children (three daughters and three sons).  She is a farmer and resides in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She has been farming her own one-hectare farmland for almost ten years. To earn better income to support a big family, she also sells fish as a secondary business.  

Chhat’s group consists of two members. Chhat has been with VisionFund for five years while her co-member has just joined with VisionFund for this loan cycle.  Since 2006, the loan has helped her make a better living. Now she earns around US$15 per day from her current business and is able to save less than US$3 each day.   

Now Chhat is requesting another loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to buy fish to resell. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income so she can set aside some money to afford some necessary household comforts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fish

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath is a construction worker, while his wife, Touch, sells cake in her village. They have been married since 1990 and have four children--one son and three daughters. Two are garment workers. One is a Koran translator, and the other attends school. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam Ath is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike for his daughter to drive to school. Because the old motorbike (pictured next to Sam Ath) breaks and uses more gasoline than new ones, Sam Ath will sell it and add to the money from the loan to buy a new model.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his daughter to drive to school

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en:
Hoeun is 51 years old and married. She has eight children--three daughters and five sons, two of whom are dependents working for pay in Thailand. Her main income is from her grocery business, where she sells detergent, soap, eggs, biscuits, seasonings, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for more than 20 years, while her husband is motor taxi driver to help earn income to support their big family.

Hoeun received a loan from VisionFund six years ago and successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Since 2005, the loan has helped her afford sufficient food and make a better living. With her current business, she earns US $15 per day, but she can only save US $2 each day. Hoeun and the other five members in the group, who have also been with VisionFund from two to six years, are applying for another loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she plans to use this loan to buy more grocery items for her store. She hopes to increase her business so as to earn a larger income to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Samneang's Group

texts.en:
Samneang is a 25-year-old mother of two small children who are still under-aged for schooling. She has been working on her corn field and selling fruit for five years with her husband for the entire family to survive.

She joined VisionFund in 2010. She and her group member have been with VisionFund for the past two loan cycles already. The loan has helped her to expand her corn field, increase her capital for fruit selling, and increase her family's income. With good business, she is applying for another loan. 

As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy seed and fertilizer, and a portion will be uses to buy more fruits for sale. She hopes to increase her business and make a better living with her current business.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for the farmland, and more fruits for sale

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng is a 63-year-old father of eight children: three daughters and five sons, four of whom are dependent and still in school.  He is the breadwinner for his family.  He resides in a village in the Moung Russey district, where crop farming is common.  Soeng is a farmer who has been farming rice on his own farmland for more than 20 years. He also raises pig for extra income.

Soeng has joined with VisionFund since 2007. He has used the loans to make his living better and send his children to school regularly. He currently earns more than US$10 per day but is able to save only around US$3.  Now he is requesting another loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for his farm.  He hopes to increase his crop yield and earn a larger income so as to set aside some money to buy a water pump for his farmland and keep his children in school.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s public call office (PCO) business. With the loan investment, he will buy some telephone sets and calling cards to offer enhanced calling services to his customers and increase his profits. He also works as a security guard and in his absence, Sughran takes care of his business.

She has given birth to four children. Due to financial constraints, she is unable to provide them with educational facilities.

Her husband started his business last year and Sughran is hopeful that a loan investment will help him establish his business and help her family live a better life as a result.

loans.use: To buy phone sets and calling cards for her husband's business

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
As a 34-year-old farmer in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Savy has two dependent children (one son and one daughter) and they both are still in school and help with family’s business. In addition to her rice farming, she also sells food and dessert in the village to earn more income. She has been in this business for five years. 

Now Savy is taking her third loan with VisionFund since 2008 while the other member in the group has just joined with VisionFund this loan cycle. The loan has helped her have a regular business. With her current business, she can earn more than US $30 per day but is able to save around US$7 each day. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her one-hectare farmland for dry season rice. She hopes to increase her crop yield, improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her one-hectare farmland for the dry season rice

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en:
Ancille is 42 years old.  She is married and has four children between the ages 8 and 21 years old. Her tailoring business is well-organized and she works from 8 am until 5 pm every day. Ancille employs two people to help her and she has three years of experience in this business. 

Ancille has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more materials to sew clothes to sell. With the loan, Ancille will increase her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Sava

texts.en:
Sava is 50 years old and her husband, Chis, is 56 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away.  They have six children -- one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married, three are garment workers, and one sells sugarcane juice in the village. 
  
Sava and her husband are rice farmers.  In addition, Chis also does construction work when he is free from farming.
