Sava’s daughter, who is married, wants to live in a separate home, but she does not have enough money. Hence Sava decided to apply for a loan to help her daughter.  Sava is asking for a loan of $500 to build a house for her daughter to live in.
  
Photo: Sava is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: build a house for her daughter

loans.name: Sam Aun

texts.en:
Sam Aun, age 32, is a weaver. Her husband, Veasna, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2001 and have four children -- three sons and one daughter, one attends school and other three are still young. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam Aun stays with her parents because she does not have her own house. She now wants to live separately, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build her own house.

loans.use: build a house

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A 45-year-old mother of five dependent sons residing in a village of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Pov is a rice farmer who has been farming twice per year as her main source of income while her husband catches fish for sale. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Pov’s group consists of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for five years while her fellow members have been with VisionFund from two to four years. Since 2006, the loans have helped her make a better living. Now she earns around US$10 per day from her current business but is able to save US$3 each day. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for her dry-season rice and use a portion to grow vegetables as another source of income. With this loan, she hopes to earn a larger income so as to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her dry-season rice and to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Sopheak is 29 years old and married with a young child. She is a resident of a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia in Battambang Province. Agriculture is one of the common businesses in her village and for the last nine years, Sopheak and her husband have worked planting corn and cassava as their primary business. They sometimes also work for others to better feed their family. Sopheak has been with VisionFund since 2008 and has borrowed and repaid three previous loan cycles. As a result,  she has improved her living standards and has had sufficient food to eat. 

Sopheak is requesting another group loan with a group that has been with VisionFund for five years. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her corn plantation. Sopheak hopes to improve her income, have a big house, and buy a motorbike for her current business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yeth's Group

texts.en:
Yeth is 37 years old and is married with two dependent sons who are still in school. He is a rural villager of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. For the past five years, Yeth has been a rice farmer and this is his main source of income. To earn additional income to feed his family, he buys and sells renewable items in his village. 

Yeth is a member of a loan group that has been with VisionFund for two years. Since 2009, loans have helped him and his members make a living better. With his current business, he earns around 25 USD each day, but is unable to save more than 4 USD daily. 

Yeth is leading his group to request another loan with VisionFund. He plans to use his entire loan to buy more recycled items to sell. In the future, he hopes to increase his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy recycled items to sell

loans.name: Pysey

texts.en:
Pysey (in the photo) sells fruits. She buys many kinds of fruit from farms for reselling around her village in a boat, riding up and down the Mekong River. Her husband, Rathmony is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1990 and have two children - one son who is a motorbike repairman and one daughter who is a garment worker. 

Pysey is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to lay bricks and plaster the wall of a concrete room under her wooden house in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay bricks and plaster a wall to enhance her home

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch (in the photo), age 32, is a garment worker. Her husband Sophal, age 40, is a garment worker alongside his wife. They live about eight kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have one daughter who attends school.  

Sreytouch is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives, because her house is old and breaks, as shown in the picture.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Chrib

texts.en:
Chrib, 36, is the mother of three daughters, all of whom are still in school. She is a farmer in one of the remote villages located in the Bovel district of Battambang Province. While farming is her primary source of income, she also works for wages and sells cows for extra income. She has been making a living in this way for five years.

Chrib received her first loan from VisionFund in 2010 and made successful repayment. The past loan improved her family's condition gradually, and now she can send her children to school regularly. She is requesting another loan from VisionFund. With this new loan, she will buy a small plot of land for growing rice. She will also use a small portion of this loan to buy more cows for sale. She hopes to make a better living and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy a smalll plot of land for growing rice and to buy cows for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 38 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. He has three years experience selling soft drinks and works from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

He is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy more soft drinks like juice, water, beer to sell. Emmanuel will use the profits from this loan to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more juice, water, beer and so on to sell.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, age 40, lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with one son and two daughters, two have full-time employment and one is in school.

Phally is a rice farmer. She is applying for her first loan of $800 to buy a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

Photo: Phally is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is 52 years old. She is very active and works as a laborer to financially contribute to the family. Her husband operates a loading business. He has a donkey cart, he puts the goods on it and delivers to its destination. Shagufta has given birth to 6 children, 2 of them work, while 2 of her remaining children are studying.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to buy a new cart for the improvement of his business. His current cart has become rough and he is unable to put heavy loads on it. Shagufta is hopeful that by purchasing a new donkey cart, her husband will be able to operate his business better and increase his income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shagufta.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a loading business

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat is a garment worker and her husband, Chea, is a driver. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and have one young son. 

Savat had asked for Kiva loan once before. She now is asking for another loan in the amount of $300 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: build a fence around her house

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly sells vegetables and fish in her local village. Her husband is a driver for a company in Phnom Penh City. Chhunly previously asked for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and she bought a motorbike as planned.  But, that motorbike was a second-hand, not a new one. It broke and used a lot of gasoline. That’s why Chhunly decided to sell it.  She is now applying for another loan of $500 to add to the money she got from selling the second-hand motorbike in order to purchase a new one. 

Chhunly and husband have been married since 2009 and have no children yet. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Varujan

texts.en: Varujan lives in Gndevaz village with his father and sister. He works as a driver, but the salary is too low to sustain his family, so Varujan is also involved in livestock breeding. He farms cows, sheep, and hens. Varujan would like to purchase more cows and increase his income by selling milk and meat. This will allow him to invest in his farm's future development.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
A resident in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia, Thea is 24 years old and has only one child. She earns a living by planting maize with her husband. She also sells vegetables as a main source of income for her family. She has been in this business for three years. With her current business, she earns 18,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for Thea's group with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of six female members. She and the other five members of the group are applying for their first loan with VisionFund at 1,000,000 KHR each. Thea, the leader of the group, will use the entire loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her farm. With this loan, she hopes to increase crop yield so as to earn a larger income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Petronille

texts.fr:
Pétronille  est née au Rwanda. Elle a 53 ans et elle est veuve avec 4 enfants de 18 à 23 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Pétronille est commerçante. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des matériels utiliser pour vendre l’électricité et renforcer son activité de vidéothèque.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’améliorer la qualité de service pour augmenter le nombre des clients. Dans les prochaines années, Pétronille voudrait être une grande commerçante dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants, améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pétronille was born in Rwanda. She is 53 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 18 and 23, all of whom have attended school. She supports two people other than her children. She has six years of primary education.

Pétronille is a shopkeeper. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy equipment to use to sell electricity, and to strengthen her video library business.

Her strategy for growing her business is to improve the quality of service in order to increase her customer base. In the coming years, Pétronille would like her business to become more large-scale in her region. With the profits, she plans to pay for her children's education and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment to use for selling electricity, and to strengthen her video library business

loans.name: Alishan

texts.en:
Alishan is 31 years old. He lives with his parents and his wife. Alishan works at the local village hall, and he is also engaged in cattle breeding. 

Alishan has applied for a loan to expand his farm. He plans to purchase cattle and forage. By increasing his number of cattle, Alishan will make his farm more profitable and be able to save to invest in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

location.town: Nor Sasnashen village of Aragatsotn region

loans.name: C13021 Twikuremubukene Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 40 years old and is married with five children between the ages of six and nine. She is the president of the C13021 Twikuremubukene group, and she is the first person on the right side. Eugenie has been selling fruits and vegetables for five years. Her business is well organized, and she works from 6am until 6pm every day.  

Eugenie has requested a loan from the Vision Finance company, a Kiva lender, in order to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell. Eugenie plans to use her profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: C4593 Dukore Group

texts.en:
Theogene is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of four and 11. Theogene operates a general store, selling goods like rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, soap, and cooking oil. He employs one person to help him and works from 6am until 10pm every day. He is the president of this borrowing team, which is called "C4593 Dukore" in the local language. 

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more goods to sell. With his profits, Theogene will be able to reinvest in his business and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Marzpet

texts.en: Marzpet lives with his wife and son, and he has been engaged in cattle breeding for nine years. Unable to find sufficient financial means to purchase forage for the cattle, Marzpet has applied for a loan. This loan will allow Marzpet to keep his farm stable and develop it. This is vital for Marzpet, as he will increase his income and insure higher living standards for his family.

loans.use: to pay for forage for his cattle.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 27 years old and single. He owns a business selling soap, rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and other goods. He has been in this business for one year, and he works from 7 am until 9 pm every day.

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by buying more items to sell, such as rice, beans, cooking oil, breads, and soft drinks. He plans to reinvest any profits in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his general store.

loans.name: C13022 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 43 years old; he is married with four children between the ages of five and ten. Vincent, who is raising his hand in the photo, works from 6am until 6pm every day selling sorghum and beans. 

Vincent has requested a loan from the Vision Finance company, a Kiva lender, in order to increase his business by buying more sorghum and beans to sell. Vincent plans to reinvest his profits in his business and to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en: Vahan is a 44-year-old farmer who lives with his wife, mother, and two sons. He keeps an orchard, where he grows grapes and apricots. Vahan would like to develop his orchard, and he also wants to expand into cattle breeding. With the help of this loan, Vahan will purchase cattle and forage. This loan will help Vahan to increase his income and insure a better life for his family by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and forage.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her husband and three children. For the past seven years she has run a small livestock farm with the help of her husband. 

Gayane has applied for this loan to buy more livestock. She hopes this will help her to make her farm more profitable and develop other fields of agriculture, too.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

location.town: Nor Sasnashen village of Aragatsotn region

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet lives with his wife and two sons, and he is involved in cattle breeding. He has applied for a loan to increase his number of cattle and purchase forage. With the help of this loan Hamlet will develop his farm, which will allow him to earn more income. With the additional income, Hamlet will insure a more stable future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a 22-year-old farmer. He lives with his parents and brother. In addition to his agricultural work, Artur also works at a factory. Artur is the main breadwinner in the family, and his current income is barely enough to make ends meet. 

To solve this problem, Artur is requesting a loan to increase the number of cattle on his farm and purchase forage to feed them. This loan will help Artur to develop his farm, earn additional income, and insure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle and forage.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 45-year-old married woman who has five sons and daughters; one of them has recently joined the military.

Fatmeh works as a nurse in a hospital and her husband works in the Ministry of Education. Their oldest son Ibrahim, 20 years old, is a second year college student majoring in crime studies.

Fatmeh has applied for this loan so they can pay for their son’s semester fees to continue and get his Bachelor's degree. Because Fatmeh is a conservative person, she asked for her son Ibrahim to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Abagwaneza Group

texts.fr:
Fiston fait partie du groupe Abagwaneza, il  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 26  ans et est marié à  Véronique, commerçante de poisson (ndagala) et tomate. Ensemble ils ont 1enfant de 2 ans.

Il est coiffeur et réparateur (bobinage) des machines.

Il est à son septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et mettre en place une salle de vidéo. L’entrée dans la salle sera payante à  quiconque viendra  voir un film.

Dans les prochaines  années il voudrait   acheter une parcelle, une voiture.il aimerait voir son enfant continuer les études
texts.en: Fiston is a member of the Abagwaneza group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 26 years old and married to Véronique, who sells fish (ndagala) and tomatoes.  They have a two-year-old child together.  Fiston works as a hairdresser and also repairs reels of movie projectors.  This is his seventh loan with Turame.  With the loan received from KIVA, he will increase his capital and set up a room for video projection.  He will charge an entrance fee to anyone who comes to watch a movie.  In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and a car.  He would also like to send his child to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and set up a room for video projection, with an entrance fee.

loans.name: Thekrayat

texts.en:
Thekrayat, 30 years old, is a married lady. She has a son and a daughter.

Two years ago, Thekrayat bought a few blankets and sold them to relatives by chance. Other relatives and friends who knew, asked her to bring them some more blankets so she decided to turn it into a small business at home. She added a few types of home products besides blankets.

Now she has applied for a loan to increase the number of blankets she has and bring in more types of home products.

loans.use: to buy blankets and more home products

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is very supportive and sells animals to financially support her husband. She buys young goats, sheep, and buffalo and raises them by giving them good quality food, then sells them to butchers and other people at a profit. 

Her husband sells wheat and other agricultural products such as rice, etc. 

Bilqees is the mother of a son and two daughters. Her son is a rickshaw driver while her daughters are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal-selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy a buffalo for selling at a profit after raising it. She will also sells its milk to her community clients for making extra profits. 

She is new to her business and hopes that this investment will be a profitable one for her.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to raise and sell

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar, a 36-year-old single lady, works as an accountant at a Jordanian academy. She has one sister and four brothers, and since Kawthar is the oldest she keeps feeling that she has the responsibility to take care of her brothers and sisters.

One of her brothers, Mohammad, 26 years old, is a student in his fourth year majoring in accounting like his sister. He wants to get his Bachelor's degree and continue to get a Master's degree and work in the banking field at the same time.

Kawthar has applied for this loan in order to help her brother achieve his dream by paying his semester fees. Because Kawthar is a conservative person, she asked her brother Mohammad to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 21-year-old single lady. She has a brother and a sister who are older than she.

Farah is in her second year in college, studying accounting. She is hoping that after graduating she will work in the field of her major. Today Farah has applied for a loan in order to pay for her semester’s fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester’s fees.

loans.name: Dilshad's Group

texts.en:
Dilshad, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a housewife, and she also provides full support to her husband in operating his livestock and diary business by taking care of the animals and giving them food on time. She has given birth to a son and a daughter, both of whom work as farmers. 

Dilshad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy a buffalo to increase the business's milk productivity. This will allow him to fulfill the dairy needs of clients in his community and increase his profits. Dilshad is very hopeful that her family business will grow by purchasing another buffalo and that her family will be able to improve its living standard as a result.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is the mother of two sons. Both of them are young and work with their father who has a crockery selling business. 

Nazeeran also helps her husband and sells crockery to her community clients. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her family business. With the loan investment, her husband will buy crockery sets, cups, glasses, etc. that will allow him to offer better variety to his customers and increase his sales and profits. 

He is very experienced in his business and Nazeeran is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: To buy cups, glasses, and crockery sets for crockery selling business

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa, a 28-year-old lady, is married to Mousa, 29 years old, and has three beautiful daughters.

Her husband Mousa has a restaurant that sells falafel, hummus and foul (broad beans), in addition to sandwiches. The restaurant has been running for three years now, and Wafaa wanted to support her husband and buy more goods for the restaurant so he can make other types of sandwiches than falafel. For that reason, she has applied for a youth loan.

Because Wafaa is a conservative person, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy more goods for the restaurant.

loans.name: Aalishan's Group

texts.en:
Aalishan has requested loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's clothes-selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy clothes in larger quantity and of greater variety that will allow him to fulfill his clients' needs and increase his sales and income. 

Aalishan is the mother of seven children. Except for her youngest son, her  children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

It is very difficult for Aalishan's husband to afford the living and education expenses of his children because his is the only income for the family. 

Aalishan is hopeful that the loan will help him earn more income from his business and her family's financial conditions will be improved.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of clothes for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Giramahoro Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Giramahoro,  il habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a  30 ans, sa femme s'appelle Marie Goreth. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants, l’un a 4 ans et l’autre a 6 ans, l’aîné étudie en troisième  année maternelle. Emmanuel  vit avec sa sœur et  ses 4 belles sœurs.

Il est  commerçant du riz, haricot, casserole, depuis 5ans.

Il est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une nouvelle variété de riz : riz tanzanien,  une nouvelle variété de haricot. 

Dans les années à venir il voudrait progresser dans le commerce et ainsi  ses enfants  auront un avenir promettant.
texts.en: Emmanuel is a member of the Giramahoro group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 30 years old, his wife's name is Marie Goreth.  They have two children together, 4 and 6 years old.  The oldest one is in his third year of preschool.  Emmanuel lives with his sister and his four sisters-in-law.  He has been selling rice, beans and cooking pans for five years.  This is his ninth loan from Turame.  With the loan received from KIVA, he will increase his capital and buy a new variety of rice (Tanzanian rice), as well as a new variety of beans.  In the coming years, he would like to do better at his business, so that his children can have a promising future.

loans.use: To buy a new variety of rice (Tanzanian rice) and a new variety of beans.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 43 years old and married. She supports her family financially by sewing clothes. Due to her good skills and command over her work, she receives regular orders every month. 

Her husband is a salesman and supplies toffees, candies, bread etc. to different general and grocery stores of the city. 

Shahnaz has three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son has an auto-repair business and her daughters are studying. Her remaining two sons stay at home. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son's business. With the loan investment, he will buy tools to offer better auto-repair services to his customers and increase his profits. 

He has been operating his business for many years and Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan investment will help him make more profits from his business. 

Note: in the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy tools for an auto-repair business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, 56 years old, is an illiterate woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband has recently retired from his work.

Aisha has been working from home making cleaning detergents for a while now to have more income for the family. After making those detergents, she pours it into different size bottles to sell or refill for her customer.

Now Aisha has applied for a loan to buy more chemical products that are used for making the detergents.

loans.use: to buy more chemical products to make detergents

loans.name: Yavar

texts.en:
Yavar is a 32-year-old woman. She is married with four children. She is a market vendor who sells different kinds of food like butter, macaroni, beverages, chips, chocolate, and some home products. She has five years of experience in this field, which make her as an experienced person. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge to run the business. She knows well the customers needs and is always polite and friendly with them.

Yavar has established her business and relationship with suppliers, which makes her business successful.  She has another secret of being so prosperous, it is the good location of her store. It is located in the central bazaar, and during the day, a lot of people pass her shop and always come inside to buy something. The products she sells are very popular. Her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Now, Yavar applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more food products for her shop and increase the monthly turnover.

loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s meat selling business. He will use this loan to buy goats and sheep in order to sell better quality meat and increase his income. He has been operating his business for many years and Shabana is confident that it will improve as a result of this investment.

Shabana also works to contribute financially to the family. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighboring clients.She is greatly skilled in her work and receives regular orders every month. Shabana has 4 children, 2 of whom study while the others stay at home. She is a very positive woman and is confident that her husband will have great success in his business after this loan investment.

Note: In the photo, Shabana is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en:
Ameeneh, 48 years old, is a married lady who has five sons and one daughter. Her husband has another five sons and daughters from another wife.
To be able to support their big family, Ameeneh started a small retail business selling blankets and clothes at home. She hopes that one day she can open her own store for selling clothes. But now, Ameeneh has applied for a loan so she can increase the amount of goods that she has in order to increase her income.

Since Ameeneh is a conservative person, she asked her brother-in-law to take the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, blankets and home products.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 57 years old, is a married lady who has two sons and three daughters. Her husband has retired from the military and is working in a private office.

Fatmeh has had a small home business for more than five years now selling clothes, home products and blankets to relatives and friends.

Fatmeh has applied for a loan to buy more home products and blankets since she is almost out of them.

loans.use: to buy more home products and blankets

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, 40 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has been selling secondhand clothes to earn a living for 5 years. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since Patricia joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. Patricia has applied for a KES 60,000 loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Rabeeha

texts.en:
Rabeeha, 33 years old, is a married lady who has two sons and one daughter.

Recently she started a small retail business and is still working on improving it. She sells clothes and blankets. Sometimes she sells simple kitchen tools, depending on what she has.

Now Rabeeha wants to increase the quantity of products that she is selling so she can get a higher profit out of it. For that reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa, 30 years old, is a father who has a boy and a girl.

He works as a distributor for many products such as clothing tweezers, clothes, perfumes, and other items. He either distributes them to the shops or to houses, depending on his customers.

Mustafa hopes that one day he can have his own shop for selling those products instead of distributing, but now he has applied for a loan to buy more products that were requested such as blankets.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda, 42 years old, is widowed. She has one son to raise after her husband passed away.

To be able to support her son, Ayda started a retail business selling clothes and blankets.

She has applied for a loan to buy more products such as home products so she can cover most of the neighbor's needs.

loans.use: to buy more home products

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her crockery selling business. She is very supportive and has been operating her business for many years. Bashiraan plans to use this loan to buy crockery sets, glasses and cups in larger quantities and of different varieties and qualities that will allow her to earn more profit from her business by selling these items at higher prices. Bashiraan has 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her eldest son is a mason and contributes to the family financially. Her two younger daughters are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Bashiraan works very hard in her business and is very hopeful about its success after the loan investment.

In the photo, Bashiraan is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy crockery sets, glasses and cups

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida is married and has 3 sons. Her eldest son is 27 years old and is a driver by profession. In order to financially contribute to the family, Hamida operates a grocery store, selling cooking oils, bread, spices and other household items to her community clients at low rates. She is very experienced and has been operating her business for many years. Hamida is also a very good house administrator who manages her household expenses very well. 

Hamida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her grocery business. She plans to use the loan to buy grocery stock such as spices, cooking oils, etc. in larger quantities that will allow her to fulfill her clients' needs and increase her sales and profits. She is confident that this loan investment will be a profitable one for her.

Note: In the photo, Hamida is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as cooking oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business of catering. He offers his services at wedding ceremonies, parties, and functions. 

With the loan investment, he will buy tents and other catering materials that will allow him to offer better services to his customers and increase his income.

Samina is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her elder son operates a welding business while two of her remaining children are getting their education.

She is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home.

Samina is confident that the loan will be productive for her husband in his business and her family will be able to have a better financial life as a result.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina.

loans.use: to buy tents and other catering supplies for her husband's catering business.

loans.name: Saphinah

texts.en:
Saphinah is 53 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sodas and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy sodas and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina is the mother of five children. Her eldest son is married and is a driver by profession. He drives an auto-rickshaw (motorized rickshaw) and provides transport services to his passengers and school children.

Rozina's remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son, who wants to change his rickshaw’s tires. By doing that, he will be able to drive it more smoothly and provide better quality transportation services to his passengers.

Rozina is hopeful that her son will be able to increase his profits as a result of a loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rozina.

loans.use: to buy tires for her son's auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam, 33 years old, runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed three people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Miriam has been able to grow her business and hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy maize flour and loaves of bread.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and loaves of bread

loans.name: C4714 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 39 years old and married. She has operated a well-organized business for the past year, selling sorghum and beans in her market. She works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Mariam is the president in this group, which is called "C4714 Intwari" in the local language. She is the first person on the left side of the photo.

Mariam has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more quantities of sorghum and beans to sell. She will use the profit from this loan to reinvest in her business and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 5 years. Her business is well-organized. She sells clothes and works from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm every day. Christine has two years of experience in her business. 

Christine has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more clothes to sell. With the profit from the loan, Christine will be able to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lutfia

texts.en:
Lutfia, 49 years old, is a widow who is raising six sons and daughters on her own.

She started working as a tailor almost five years ago so she can help in supporting the family now that they have no income besides what she earns. Lutfia wants to enhance the service she provides so she can bring in more customers. She has applied for a loan to buy special accessories that can be added on clothes and more fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric and special accessories that can be added on clothes

loans.name: Lateefan's Group

texts.en:
Lateefan has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her shoe making and sales business. She will use the loan to buy leather, shoe laces, etc. which will allow her to make better quality shoes and increase her sales and profits. Lateefan is very experienced in her work and is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her and expand her business.

Lateefan has 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her 2 daughters also support her in her business while her eldest son sells fruits. Note: In the photo, Lateefan is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy leather and shoe laces

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, 49 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has operated a carpentry business for 15 years and employs one person. Julius earns extra income from the sale of paraffin. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. Julius has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber and nails.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old, married, and has two children, ages 13 and 18. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for twenty-two years and has employed three people. She earns extra income from poultry farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Agnes has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 80,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida, 32 years old, is married and has 3 daughters. Two of her daughters are studying and the youngest one is not yet a year old. Zahida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business selling plastic utensils. She operates her business from home and deals very professionally with her clients. Since she offers them good quality utensils at low rates, she makes good sales every month. Zahida will use this loan to buy plastic utensils in larger quantities in order to earn more profit. She is very confident that this loan will enable her business to become more profitable.

Note: In the photo, Zahida is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils to sell for profit.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit is a construction worker, and his wife, Saman, sells meatballs and slush, a shaved ice dessert. They have been married since 2000 and have two young children - a son and a daughter. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Tit and his wife also grow vegetables. Tit is requesting his second loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, 27 years old, is married and has one child, aged 5. She has operated a beauty salon for 2 years and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Charity has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy weaves and a blow dryer.

loans.use: To buy weaves and a blow dryer

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a laborer while she supports her husband by doing sewing works. She has great skills in preparing beautiful looking clothes and earns a reasonably good income every month.

She is requesting a loan from Asasah, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine.  She will be able to complete her orders on time and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new food products

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is 28 years old and her husband, Darit, is 26 years old. They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children - one son and one daughter.   
 
Thavy and her husband are farmers, growing corn and melons on their farm in their village. Thavy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a new water pumping machine to spray her farm because her old one is broken.  She will also use a part of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

In the photo, Thavy is at home, and not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a new water pumping machine, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam, 31 years old, is a housewife with three kids.

She started her own business a while ago making trays from straw and other type of crafts. She hopes that one day she can open her own store for selling her handmade crafts and open a training center to teach youth how to make crafts.

Ahlam has applied for a loan to buy new material to make fabric craft like knitting and others.

loans.use: to buy new materials to make fabric crafts

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon is 60 years old and his wife, Vanda, is 53 years old. They live in a suburb about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have seven children - four sons and three daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, two are garment workers, one is a security guard and the others stay at home. Suon's wife has full-time employment in a factory.
 
Suon stays at home. The family's main source of income is from his wife's and his children’s salaries. Suon is in the process of building a new house (in the photo). He cannot finish it because he lacks money and is therefore asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to complete building his house.

loans.use: To finish building his house

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad, 42 years old, is a housewife with five sons and daughters.

Her husband Jamal owns a small food market that he wants to enhance. Suad has applied for this loan to register the store under the Ministry of Industry and Trade and then bring more food products into the store.

Since Suad is a conservative person, her husband Jamal was photographed instead.

loans.use: to register the store and buy more food to sell

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem and her husband, Phun (pictured together), live in a small village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They are fishermen who also earn money by repairing fishing nets. The elderly couple has been married for over twenty years and has two daughters who are garment workers.

Soem has applied for this loan because she wants to remodel their house by installing a concrete foundation.

loans.use: to remodel the house by installing a concrete foundation.

loans.name: Kon Thea

texts.en:
Kon Thea is a garment worker and her husband, Phan, is a motor taxi driver. They live in a small village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children - one son and one daughter.

Kon Thea is asking for a loan of US $300 to connect her house to the private electricity utility service. At present, the family does not have electricity and must use batteries.

loans.use: To connect her house to the electricity utility service

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 41 years old, is married and has three children. He has operated a business selling music discs and tapes for one year and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Joseph has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy music discs and tapes.

loans.use: To buy music discs and tapes

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Samoeun (pictured in the photo above) is 46 years old and her husband, Lim, is 51 years old.  They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 1984 and have three sons.  One of their sons is married and lives outside the family home while the other two are in school.
 
Samoeun stays at home and does housework.  The main source of income is from her husband’s salary as a lathe operator.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to pay school fees for her son who is in his second year of studying banking at university.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek (pictured at home) is 43 years old and her husband, Srey, is 42 years old. They live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 25 years and have 6 children - 3 sons and 3 daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, three are garment workers and two attend school.  

Chek is a farmer and her husband is a traditional musician who does construction when he is free. Cambodian people prefer to hire traditional musicians to entertain at weddings and religious ceremonies. Since there are now lots of weddings and religious ceremonies, Chek is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. She started her business a few years ago because her husband’s animal sales business was not profitable enough to provide for the entire family's living expenses. Amna now has a good name among her community clients and she receives regular orders every month due to her good quality work. She will use the loan investment to buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her profits.

Amna has 4 daughters and a son. Four of them are studying while her youngest daughter is only 2 years old. Amna is a very hardworking woman and has a lot of confidence in her abilities. She is confident that her business will become more profitable as a result of this loan.

Note: In the photo, Amna is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Geffrey

texts.en:
Geffrey is 48 years old.  He is married and has three children.  

To earn a living, Geffrey runs a retail shop and he has been in business for 15 years.  He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition.  He has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES in order to buy maize flour, sugar and loaves of bread.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and loaves of bread

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong and his wife are farmers and he is also a fisherman. Huong and his wife have been married since 1983 and have nine children: seven sons and two daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, two were hired to raise chickens and the others attend school and assist their parents in the farming business when they are not at school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Huong is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy a water pump and pipe to spray his farm. Because he does not have a water pump, he borrows from his sister or his neighbors often.  

Photo: Huong is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and pipe to spray his farm.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi (pictured in the photograph above) and her husband, Nen, are rice farmers.  She also sells a paste of fermented rice, which is eaten as a dessert, in her village when she has free time.  Yi is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.  

Yi and her husband have been married since 1979 and have five sons.  Three of their sons are married and live outside the family home, one sells ice cream and another attends in school.  They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a weaver and her husband is a horse cart driver. They have two daughters; one attends school and one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthou is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan sells grocery items in her village and her husband is a construction worker. They have been married since 2000 and have three children - one son and two daughters. Two of the children are in school and one is still too young. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophan has already asked for a Kiva loan to buy grocery items for resale. She hopes to continue expanding her business because it is doing well. Therefore, she has applied for another loan in the amount of $500 to buy more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang (pictured with her loom), age 34, is a weaver. Her husband, Heang, age 35, has full-time employment in an organization. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have two daughters. One of their daughters attends school and another one is still young.  

Sreyneang is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to get to work because the old motorbike breaks very often, is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband and weaving materials

loans.name: Ittefaq's Group

texts.en:
Ittefaq is married and is 34 years of age. Her husband is a salesman and supplies toffees and candies to different general stores and grocery stores in the city.

Ittefaq supports her husband by sewing clothes. She loves her profession and works with a great level of dedication. Her customers are very happy with her quality of work and give her regular orders.

She has given birth to three daughters and two sons. Except for her eldest daughter, all of her children are enrolled in local school and getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy candies and toffees in larger quantity that will allow him to fulfill the client orders on time and increase his income.

Ittefaq has a lot of confidence in her husband. She hopes that her family’s living standard will be improved as a result of the loan investment.

Note: "In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ittefaq."

loans.use: To buy candies and toffees

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en: Kanha and her husband, Vannra, are tailors. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. Kanha is asking for her second loan in the amount of $500 to level her house's foundation.

loans.use: To level her house's foundation.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea and her husband, Kosal, are vegetable farmers.  They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three sons who are attending school. 

Chea is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to build a shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

In the photograph above, Chea is pictured at home rather than at the farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and to build a shelter to shade her vegetables from sunlight.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en: Seline is 24 years old and married with two children. She sells vegetables, bananas and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as good because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy vegetables and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and bananas to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. She sells food such as tea and bread to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Samon (pictured in the photograph above) is 42 years old and his wife, Sophirin, is 31 years old.  They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 1989 and have three sons.  One of their sons attends school while the other two are still too young for school.   

Samon has his own remoque (a motorbike with a trailer connected at the back) and he uses it to carry fruit for his fellow villagers and gets paid through the fees he charges for his services.  His wife is a cobbler in a shoe factory. 

Samon is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to organize his house by laying and plastering the floor in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: to lay and plaster the floor in his house.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim (in the pictured) is 29 years old and her husband, Ratana, is 28 years old. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son.  

Tim and her husband work at a brick kiln alongside where they live. Tim is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy her neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly (pictured here) is 42 years old and her husband, Sopheap is 43 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have three daughters. One is in university, another one is in grade eight and another one is still young. They live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Somaly is a weaver. In addition, she buys silk and cotton fabrics from other weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $300 to buy additional silk and cotton fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk and cotton fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Kavuo

texts.en: Kavuo is 33 years old. He is married with one child, aged 2 years. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living; he has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy a motorbike and has hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: C2681 Kora Group

texts.en:
Theoneste is 51 years-old and is married with five children between the ages 12 and 28 years old.  His business is well organized.  He sells general use items such as sugar, rice, Irish potatoes, salt, etc.  He works from 6am until 8pm every day. Theoneste  employs one person to help him and they have  two years of experience. 

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase rice, soap, salt, sugar, Irish potatoes, etc to sell. With the profits from the loan, he will be able to build his own house, to pay children's school fees and to save money for his future.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of sugar, rice, Irish potatoes, salt, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is 45 years-old. She is married and performs her household responsibilities by staying at home.

Her husband has a business of plastic beans.  It is used in making shopping bags and other plastic items.

Ramzana has given birth to four children. Her eldest son works at a local food restaurant while others stay at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy plastic beans in larger quantities for preparing plastic items and shopping bags in bulk.  This will help him fulfill the client orders on time and increase his income.

He has been operating his business for the past many years and Ramzana is hopeful that a loan investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy plastic beans for a shopping bag making and selling business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a businesswoman, she sells cabbages to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her rental houses. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings in order to buy more cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages to sell.

loans.name: C2682 Imanzi Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 39 years-old and is married with four children between the ages 3 and 10 years old. Her business is well organized she sells general goods such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar, Irish potatoes. She works from 6am until 6pm every day and has three years of experience. Eugenie employs two people o help her.

Eugenie has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Ffinance Company in order to purchase more quantity of products such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar, Irish potatoes, etc to sell. With the profits, she will pay children's school fees and renovate her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as tomato sauce, juice, salt, sugar, Irish potatoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years-old and married with three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings in order to buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 38-year-old man.  He is a father with three sons and one daughter.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.  Hani is raising rabbits for sale, which is a profitable project and helps in increasing his income.  He wants to purchase more rabbits and cages, so he is requesting a US$800 loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost. This will increase his sales and improve his family's income positively. Hani is photographed in the place where he is raising rabbits.

loans.use: buy rabbits and cages

loans.name: Simeho

texts.en: Simeho is a 31-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for the last eleven years, and his major challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of having a wholesale shop. Simeho needs the loan to buy sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en: Benedetta is 55 years old and is married.  She sells tea leaves and soaps to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 13 years and has employed one person.  She also earns extra income from her farming activities.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future.  Benedetta has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy soaps and tea leaves.

loans.use: To buy soaps and tea leaves

loans.name: Lakisa

texts.en: Lakisa is a 44-year-old hardworking lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been a cloth dealer for the last 25 years, after starting with a capital of 100,000 UGX and now has over 3 million. Her major challenge has been inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Lakisa needs a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz is a 31-year-old man who sells different kinds of products in the central bazaar of his hometown.  He is married and has two children. He sells products like macaroni, sugar, salt, butter, beverages, etc., and has been in business for the last four years. 

The products Chingiz sells are very popular among the local people and his attitude towards customers makes his business very successful. He usually is very friendly and polite with clients. His monthly income is 230 AZN.  This business is the only financial source for his family and he wishes to increase his sales and income. 

For this purpose, Chingiz applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to purchase more merchandise and increase his monthly turnover. This will increase his income and improve life for his family. He promises to repay on time.

loans.use: buy food products to resell

loans.name: Arqam

texts.en: Arqam, a 36-year-old married man, is supporting a family of six members. To be able to support his young family, Arqam opened a small food market that he needs to fill with more food products so he can serve his customers. Arqam has applied for a loan to buy new products for the store.

loans.use: to buy new products for the food market

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 37-year-old man who sells mobile phones and accessories. He is married and has two children. Khalid has four years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge for business.  

The products he sells are very popular because one person uses two or three mobile phones at once.  Every phone has it purpose, usually one is for family, the second for business and a third for a second business if it exists. His monthly profit is 200 AZN.

Khalid would like to increase his sales and has applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to purchase more mobile phones and accessories. He hopes this loan will help to improve life conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Khabib

texts.en:
Khabib is a 47-year-old trader.  He is married and has two sons.  He sells fresh fruits and vegetables in the central bazaar.  He has five years of experience and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge for business.  

Khabib chose this business because it  is profitable because fresh produce is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at the table in every Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch.

Khabib's monthly income is 250 AZN and he wishes to increase it to 500 AZN.  For this purpose, he has applied for a 1000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to cover customer demands. He promises to repay on time!

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en: Jameeleh is a 47-year-old single lady who is living with her mother. Five years ago, Jameeleh was able to open a small tailoring workshop, so she can support herself and her mother. Since then, she has successfully gained a good number of customers. Now Jameeleh has applied for a loan to buy more sewing machines and expand the tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and expand her tailoring workshop

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir is a 29-year-old trader who is married and has two children. Qadir has been selling different food products for the last five years. During these years he became an experienced and skilled trader.

The food products he sells are very popular among local people. He usually sells macaroni, tea, butter, ketchup, cookies and candies. His shop is located in the central market and people cross it very often. His monthly income is 350 AZN. This is the only source of income for his family. 

Qadir needs to expand his business and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: buy more food products to sell

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 36-year-old married man. He is supporting three young boys. He opened a store for selling frozen meat, fish and chicken, five years ago. During these years, he added a service of cutting and chopping the meat based on what the customer wants. Now Ashraf has applied for a loan to buy more frozen products to fill the store, and he hopes that in the future he will be a wholesale trader for these frozen food goods.

loans.use: to buy more frozen products to fill the store

loans.name: Javid

texts.en:
Javid is a 31-year-old man.  He is single and lives with his parents. Javid has been selling phone accessories for the last four years. He is very experienced in his business and knows well where to buy merchandise for a low price.  

Javid usually brings phone accessories in from other cities and buys them in wholesale markets for a low price. Then he resells them for a more profitable price in his home city. He is very friendly and has already gained some permanent clients.  His father helps him to bring in new goods from another city.  Javid`s monthly income is 200 AZN per month and he wishes to increase it to 400 AZN. 

Javid has applied for a loan of 1200 AZN in order to purchase more phone merchandise and increase his sales since this type of product is very popular. He wishes to save some money for his upcoming wedding party.

loans.use: buy phone accessories

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en: Hamad is a 31-year-old man who supports a family of five members. Hamad has run a barber shop for almost three years now, and during these years he added more than one seat. Now Hamad has applied for a loan in order to buy new barber tools and repair some internal decorations.

loans.use: to buy new barber tools and repair some internal decorations

loans.name: Gauthier Ghislain

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont deux sont sur le banc scolaire. Ayant ouvert un atelier de vulcanisation en 2003 a l'arrêt de ses etudes en classe de seconde. 
Il va bénéficie de son deuxième cycle de prêt, le premier lui a été très favorable, car avec l'argent reçu il a acheté un compresseur a air d'occasion , des chambres a air et de lots de colle pour réparer les crevaisons et usures des pneus de ces potentiels clients.
Ces ventes ont largement augmentes , il a en moyenne 45.000 frs a 75.000 frs de recettes par jour. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer son activité en ajoutant encore un autre compresseur d'air, des pneus d'occasion et neuves  et pense aussi a louer les services d'un autre ouvrier pour l'aider dans son travail vu que sa clientèle a largement augmente et ses services ont été améliores.
Pour l'avenir, il continue a épargner pour ouvrir une vulcanisation moderne.
texts.en:
This customer is 36 years old, married, and a father of three children, of which two attend school. He opened a tire repair shop in 2003 after leaving school in tenth grade.
He will benefit from his second loan cycle. The first one proved very beneficial: with the money he received, he purchased a second-hand compressor, inner tubes and glue kits to repair flat and used tires for potential clients. His sales grew up substantially, and now average 45,000 to 75,000 FCFA a day.
With this new loan, he will strengthen his business by adding yet another air compressor as well as second-hand and new tires. He is also considering hiring another worker to assist him with his work since his clientele grew and his services improved.
In the future, he will keep on saving to open a modern tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor, inner tubes, tires, and glue.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is a 37-year-old married man.  He has three sons, all of whom are students. Ashraf is employed, but does not earn enough to cover all the family's needs and education expenses. Ashraf is requesting a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator for his house to replace the old one, which is not valid for use. This will improve the family's living conditions. Ashraf is pictured in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for personal use.

loans.name: Ngute

texts.en: Ngute is 27 years old and married, with five children. He sells charcoal to earn a living, a business he has been in for five years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to grow his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase waste paper.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 41 years old and married with two children. She runs a kindergarten to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and has employed seven people. She earns extra income from farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been growing her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 35,000 Kenya Shillings to buy desks and exercise books.

loans.use: To buy desks and exercise books for her school.

loans.name: Ursula Ines Nadine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans,celibataire et mère de cinq enfants et tous vont a l'école , vivant seule après son divorce et ayant la garde de tous ses enfants , pour subvenir a leurs besoins, elle se lance dans la vente  des articles religieuses comme des bougies, des cartons de cierges des arômes, des parfums et des chapelets. 
Depuis 1991, elle se débrouillait par ses propres moyens, mais a l'heure actuelle , avec l'apport du prêt, elle a stabilisé son commerce, elle fait des provisions en stocks et en quantité énorme et ne connait plus de rupture de stocks, ses revenus ont largement augmentés et elle a fait d'énormes épargnes. 
Son esprit d'ouverture a fait d'elle une femme très entreprenante, elle veut bénéficier d'un second prêt pour renforcer le stock de ses produits.
Optimiste, elle compte aller loin avec les prêts de Hope, elle prend soin de ses enfants et assure leur scolarité sans trop de difficulté, elle veut continuer dans le meme sens, jusqu'à ce qu'elle soit grossiste.
texts.en:
This client is a 38-year old single mother of five chidlren, all of whom go to school. As she lives on her own since the divorce, and has custody of all the children she began selling religious items like candles, boxes of religious candles, aromas, perfumes and rosaries, in order to meet her chidlren's needs. 

Since 1991 she has managed on her own but now, with the help of her loan, her business is stable, she has greatly increased her inventory and never runs out of anything. Her revenue has increased sharply and she puts a good deal of money into savings. Her open spirit has made her a very enterprising person . She would like a second loan to increase her inventory. Always an optimist, she plans to go far with HOPE loans. She takes care of her children and pays for their schooling without too much difficulty. She plans to continue along the same path, until she becomes a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase cases of different colored candles, rosaries, fragrances, and perfumes

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a married mother of two who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She owns a café which has been in operation for the last one year. She started off by preparing and selling food in small quantities after which she opened the café.

Jesca was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase café stock, e.g., flour, sugar, meat and utensils. Jesca looks forward to establishing a restaurant in the future and she will save the additional income obtained from the loan. The challenges facing her business are the high cost of materials and inflation.

loans.use: to purchase café stock, e.g., flour, sugar, meat and utensils.

loans.name: Amtul's Group

texts.en:
Amtul has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business selling utensils. With this loan, he will buy utensils in larger quantity and of greater variety that will allow him to make more sales and profit. Amtul is very hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business successfully after investing the loan.

Amtul is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household responsibilities. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Two of them study, while the others stay at home. She is very confident about her family’s better financial future as a result of the loan investment.

In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah passbook) is Amtul.

loans.use: to buy utensils for a utensils business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells used clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bed sheets and women's blouses.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and women's blouses

loans.name: Symphorien

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans , célibataire sans enfant avec un niveau universitaire n'ayant pas trouvé du travail, il a ouvert une mini alimentation en 2000
Il  a remboursé et épargné  avec beaucoup de succès durant le premier cycle ce qui lui a permis de recevoir son deuxième prêt
Son mini alimentation est située dans le marché et il a des recettes qui sont comprises entre 25 000f et 50 000f par jour
Avec l’actuel prêt, il va acheter de la marchandise telle que :
1sac de riz de 560kg, 1sac de sucre de 50kg,5cartons de détergents, 5 cartons de savons, 5cartons de savons de toilettes,  10 cartons  de lait en sachets
En dehors des difficultés liées aux méventes, il achète  toujours les produits de premières nécessités.
Agrandir son mini alimentation  et fonder une famille est son souci majeur
texts.en: This client is 38 years old, single without children, with a college education. Not being able to find work, he opened a small food stall in 2000. He has repaid is first loan, which was successful and and allowed him to make savings  and so qualified for his second loan. His stall is located at the marketplace and his daily sales are between 25,000 and 50,000 francs per day. With his current loan, he is going to buy merchandise such as one 560-kg bag of rice, one 50-kg bag of sugar, five boxes of detergents, five boxes of soap, five boxes of toilet soap, 10 boxes of dry milk packs. Apart from times when there is a slump in sales, he always buys first necessity products. His main goal is to expand his store and be able to start a family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, canned food, detergents etc

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s grocery store business. He will use the loan to buy grocery stock such as cooking oils, spices, etc., in larger quantities that will allow him to fulfill larger orders and increase his sales and profit.

Mumtaz is a seamstress. She learned the art of sewing in her teenage years, and now she earns regular income from her business. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. She is unable to provide an education for her children due to financial constraints. Mumtaz is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan money and his business will improve. This will help her send her children to school for an education in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, spices, etc., for a grocery store business

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée  de 38ans, célibataire, mère d’un enfant de 22ans, est vendeuse de sandales et divers  sur un étalage  dans un marché de la place
Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un premier prêt qu’elle a rembourse sans défauts de payements
Elle s’approvisionne sur les grands marché de la capital et fais deux fois un aller retour à Kinshasa pour s'approvisionner augmenter son stock.
Ses revenus journaliers sont de 20.000frs a 45000 frs  et elle a compris  l’importance des épargnes volontaires.
Avec  l’actuel  prêt, elle va acheter les lots de sandales hommes, femmes et enfants.
